title: Crispy Spiced Chickpea Grain Bowls
subtitle: Crunchy, protein-packed, and done in 25 minutes
author: Dailyblog Kitchen
intro_html:
If you think chickpeas are boring, you haven't roasted them yet. Twenty-five minutes in a hot oven transforms canned chickpeas into crispy, golden nuggets that shatter when you bite into them. Toss them with warm spices and pile them on a grain bowl, and you've got a meal that's packed with protein, fiber, and actual flavor.

This is the kind of dinner that works on a busy Tuesday or a lazy Sunday. It's endlessly customizable — swap the grains, change the vegetables, drizzle whatever sauce lives in the back of your fridge. The chickpeas are the star, and they're hard to mess up.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Pat chickpeas VERY dry with paper towels — this is the key to crispiness. Spread them out and blot thoroughly.
Toss dried chickpeas with olive oil, smoked paprika, cumin, garlic powder, and salt.
Spread in a single layer on the baking sheet. Don't crowd them. Roast for 20-25 minutes, shaking the pan halfway through, until golden and crunchy.
While chickpeas roast, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, water, and minced garlic. Add more water if needed for a drizzlable consistency.
Divide quinoa among 4 bowls. Top with spinach, cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion.
Add crispy chickpeas on top and drizzle generously with tahini sauce. Eat immediately for maximum crunch.

tips: Pat chickpeas VERY dry — this is the #1 secret to crispiness. Wet chickpeas steam instead of roast.
Eat the chickpeas within 30 minutes of roasting for peak crunch. They soften as they cool.
Leftover bowls (without chickpeas) keep 3 days in the fridge. Roast fresh chickpeas when ready to eat.
Try adding: avocado, pickled red onion, feta crumbles, or a fried egg on top.
summary: Crispy oven-roasted chickpeas with warm spices piled on grain bowls with fresh vegetables and tahini sauce. Ready in 25 minutes, packed with protein and fiber.
